hr.span: The Pearl City Athletic Boosters will be canceling this year's annual golf outing. If you would like to support the Boosters financially, the annual sale of the Northwest Illinois Daily Drawing tickets will begin in July. Contact DJ Scott with questions!

span.style: font-size: x-large; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; font-family: latoregular; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

br.span:
This year's Upperclassman Scholarship is now available. Please download an application through the attachment below. Applications should be mailed to:
Pearl City Education Foundation, Box 278 Pearl City IL, 61062
Good luck!!!!

hr.span: The Pearl City School District Main Office will be closed due to the Stay in Shelter order by the Gov. If you need assistance please contact us through email. You may also contact your child's teacher for e-learning information by going to the school directory found under the Directory tab. Emails will be checked periodically between the hours of 8:30am and 1:30pm

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular; font-size: 16px;

h1.style: margin: 0.67em 0px; font-family: latobold; font-weight: normal; text-align: center;

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular; text-align: center;
p.span: The District does not tolerate acts of bullying and harassment on any prohibited basis, including acts of harassment based on disability, race and gender. The District has recently adopted revised bullying and harassment policies, which are available at http://www.pcwolves.net. Any person who believes he or she has been subjected to harassment or a hostile environment should report the harassment or hostile environment to the District and the District will conduct a prompt and thorough investigation into the complaint. Persons who are found to have engaged in acts of harassment or other acts that create a hostile environment will be promptly disciplined in a manner consistent with the District’s anti-harassment and bullying policies and the student code of conduct. Bullying and harassment are best prevented by students, parents and District staff working together to identify and respond to such acts.

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular;
p.span: i. 7:180 Bullying, Intimidation and Harassment of Student Prohibited

p.style: line-height: 23px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular;
p.span: ii. 7:20 Sexual Harassment of Students Prohibited
